class GenericWorkerTask

Detailed Description

A threadlet exposes a generic interface to execute parts of an application in context of another thread (i.e the GenericWorkerTask).
See also:
GenericWorkerTask

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Threadlet::Threadlet (   )

Member Function Documentation

void Threadlet::Execute (  BOOLEAN  block = TRUE  ) 
 

Launches the execution of the threadlet. If block is TRUE, an active wait is done and hence Execute behaves like a synchronous call. If block is FALSE the execution is started asynchronous and after finishing, the application the threadlet belongs to, will get informed by the message ThreadletNotificationMsg.

virtual INT Threadlet::Fn (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Fn is the function that will be executed in thread context. Be aware of restrictions to operations that can be performed in thread context.

Implemented in DecodingThreadlet, EncodingThreadlet, SyncPhoneThreadlet, UpdatePbThreadlet, FfsTestThreadlet, and UibUpdateThreadlet.

UINT Threadlet::GetReqStackSize (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
The stack size requirements of the threadlet. Default implementation will request 1024 bytes.

BOOLEAN Threadlet::IsBlocking (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
TRUE if the threadlet has been initialized to be a blocking threadlet.
See also:
Treadlet::Execute

void Threadlet::OnEndOfExecute (   )  [virtual]
 

Is invoked after Fn has been executed. The default implementation sends the message ThreadletNotificationMsg to the application that executed the threadlet. Important: when overwriting the method invoke the base-method always at the end!

Reimplemented in SyncPhoneThreadlet, and UpdatePbThreadlet.

void Threadlet::ReleaseInstance (   )  [virtual]
 

Is invoked, when the threadlet has the permission to destroy itself. Per default nothing is done. Overwriting this method is useful, if a derived class offers a static method CreateInstance, which internally allocates an instance on the heap, so that in ReleaseInstance this instance might be deleted. This releases the application, which created a worker-thread, to taking care about releasing the threadlet by listening to the message ThreadletNotificationMsg.

Reimplemented in DecodingThreadlet, EncodingThreadlet, and FfsTestThreadlet.
